citeinfo.title: Coalbed Methane Reserves (2006) and Cumulative Production (2006) by coal basin

pubinfo.publish: Energy Information Administration (EIA), Reserves and Production Division

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

descript.abstract:
Coalbed Methane (CBM) proved reserves and cumulative production by coal basin in the United States.
Proved reserves are from the Energy Information Administration's (EIA) U.S. Crude Oil, Natural Gas, and Natural Gas Liquids Reserves, 2006 Annual Report. Proved reserves are the quantities of gas that geologic and engineering data demonstrate with reasonable certainty to be recoverable in future years from known reservoirs under existing economic and operating conditions. The absolute values of proved CBM reserves for the Wind River, Forest City and Illinois basins cannot be released for reasons of confidentiality. The absolute values of proved CBM reserves for the Piceance and Gulf Coast basins are not released due to inadequate reporting. These basins are reported as "0" in the RES_2006 attribute column. The RES_RNG_06 attribute was created to show what range those values are in.
Annual coalbed methane gas production data through 12/31/2006 was obtained from 17 state oil & gas regulatory entities or geological surveys and one producing company. Data for 2006 were not yet available for West Virginia and Pennsylvania so the 2005 volumes were assumed to repeat in 2006. Produced CBM gas volumes from each state were classified by basin.
descript.purpose: To compare CBM proved reserves and cumulative production by basin.
descript.supplinf:
Most of the basin polygons are based on John Tully's 1996 "Coal Fields of the United States" USGS publication OF-96-092 which is downloadable from the National Atlas (http://nationalatlas.gov/atlasftp.html). Multiple polygon rings with the same basin name were merged into one polygon recored per basin name. Note that many of the smaller basins are not named in this dataset.
Some of the east coast basins (e.g. Danville, Culpepper) are based on the 1995-1996 USGS DDS-30, "NOGA Conventional plays within the Piedmont Province".
Alaska basins are from coalbasin.e00, supplied by Paige Peapples of the Alaska Dept of Natural Resources.
For the Uinta-Piceance Basin, a polygon from the USGS PP 1625-B study, "Geologic Asessment of Coal in the Colorado Plateau: AZ, CO, NM and UT" was substituted for the Tully polygon. For the Powder River and Williston Basins, the Tully polygons were replaced with ones from USGS PP 1625-A, "1999 Resource assessment of Selected Tertiary Coal Beds and zones in the N. Rocky Mountains & Great Plain Region".
No warranty, expressed or implied, is made by the author, by Z Inc. or by EIA regarding data accuracy, precision, currency or completeness; or concerning the results to be obtained from queries or use of the data. All data is expressly provided "AS IS" and "WITH FAULTS". The purpose of this dataset is to show the approximate location of coalbed methane fields. This layer is based on well data provided by individual organizations and state entities, which was not checked for accuracy or completeness. No responsibility is assumed for damages or other liabilities due to the accuracy, availability, use or misuse of the information herein provided. The GIS data is made available as a public service. GIS information is in the public domain and may be copied without permission; citation of the source is appreciated.

overview.eadetcit: The absolute values of proved CBM reserves for the Wind River, Forest City and Illinois basins cannot be released for reasons of confidentiality, and the absolute values of proved CBM reserves for Piceance and Gulf Coast basins are not released due to inadequate reporting.These 5 basins are reported as "0" in the RES_2006 attribute column.
